definition: should/ought to/probably/must be/to deserve/to owe/to be sb's turn to do sth/that/the above-mentioned

sentences.english: Those students deserved it they started too big of disturbence.
sentences.chinese: 那些學生自招麻煩，活該。

sentences.english: Economists who ignore the recent rise in unemployment deserve to lose their jobs.
sentences.chinese: 忽視最近失業增加經濟學家們，活該丟掉飯碗。

sentences.english: You start to doubt yourself and think you  deserve it.
sentences.chinese: 你開始懷疑自己，甚至覺得自己活該。

sentences.english: If it's Zouave, I'm damned if I'll go in the troop.
sentences.chinese: 要是採用法國步兵服呢，那我再去參軍就活該了。

sentences.english: That's what I get, going to a jock party alone.
sentences.chinese: 我這是活該，竟然獨自去參加這種士兵聚會。

sentences.english: Mike and his brother deserve it.
You can rest easy in the knowledge that you have done all you could.
sentences.chinese: 不管怎麼說你已經吃了，要是得了病也活該。

sentences.english: One of my friends is being two-timed by her boyfriend, but I think she's had it coming.
sentences.chinese: 我一個朋友最近被她男友劈腿了，但我覺得她活該。

definition: to have no sense of shame/shameless
Brothers!/brethren/dude (colloquial)/brother (diminutive form of address between males)
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to swear or curse (at people)/to scold or yell at someone
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
what are you doing?/whatever for?/why on earth?
